instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01823: What is 820-01823? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP1V05_S5: What is PP1V05_S5? PP1V05_S5 is a 1.05v power rail present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state. On 2008-2009 15” and 17” Macbook boards, this often gets stuck at 0.3v due to a bad C7771 capacitor. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
This arrived with no power. No obvious damage on the board.

While measuring rails, they are all present up to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>

Diode mode on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> is 0.008. Only 9.6 ohms.

While injecting voltage only <CHIP>U1200</CHIP> gets warm. 

On a side note <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S5</SIGNAL> voltage is fluctuating


Can this chipset can be purchased anywhere else besides Aliexpress? It is a SRH13

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Before measuring rails a DFU revive was also performed and completed successfully even though nothing ever appeared on the screen.

Should something else be checked?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: If PCH overheats on the voltage injection test, you must change it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
PCH replaced successfully. Board turns on chimes and boots now however no image or backlight on the screen. The first three lights come on but light 4 and 5 remain off. 

Do you need to perform a DFU revive after PCH replacement??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Do you get external video?

Check if these files help you.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/134xcsvLY_XJ4l0ychOT033vr8zyZjdib/view?usp=share_link[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
No external video with and without internal lcd connected. Caps lock light comes on

No change after DFU revive

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Missing internal and external video may point to GPU problem.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: When testing external I plug in through usb-c port and turn the imac on. Do any special keys need to be pressed on the keyboard during testing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: Is it really possible for PCH and the GPU to just randomly die ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
New PCH requires clean ME region.
Actually BIOS is hold by T2, so you need to pass through DFU.
Maybe solve the video problem too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: How do you perform that procedure? I assume you can’t use medusa on this one

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Once I am in DFU whats the next step? I have never cleaned ME regions manually before, only used the Medusa programmer to do it. 

Does a dfu restore need to be performed to clean the ME region?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: DFU restore will rewrite BIOS (inside T2)...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
threads.message: No change after DFU restore. What do you suggest should be checked next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01823</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power
